Description: Large medallion in tapestry applied and sewn to an undyed, plain weave linen textile; the medallion is framed by a freize of beige vegetal interlacing and stylised leaves on a red background; in the centre on a blue background, lines of beige, dots and circular motifs create lozenges; the central lonzenge has, in its middle, a medallion with a stylised human head, with dark hair on a red background; the other lozenges have, alternatively, stylised baskets with fruit and vegetables or a pair of red and yellow stylised fishes or dolphins; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/12), weft-undyed linen (S/22); two lines of 8 picks of paired threads; tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/12), weft-undyed linen (S/56), yellow, red, blue, dark blue wool (S/blue is 56); extra threads in linen and wool used to create details in relief; oversewing threads in undyed linen (S spun Z ply); all edges are ragged
Curator's comments: textile is kept on a net for stability
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
